contraindications: Cardiovascular disease. Eclampsia and severe pre-eclampsia, intra-uterine infection, intra-uterine foetal death, antepartum haemorrhage, placenta praevia and cord compression, threatened miscarriage, cardiac disease.
caution: Hypertensive ischaemic heart disease. Receiving digitalis.
name: Albuterol
side_effect: Arrythmias. Tremors, Palpitation, restlessness, nervousness, throat irritation and ankle edema. Tremor, muscle cramps, headache, hypokalaemia.

indications: Reversible airways obstruction. Premature labour.
contraindications: Cardiovascular disease. Eclampsia and severe pre-eclampsia, intra-uterine infection, intra-uterine foetal death, antepartum haemorrhage, placenta praevia and cord compression, threatened miscarriage, cardiac disease.
caution: Hypertensive ischaemic heart disease. Receiving digitalis.
name: Albuterol Sulphate
side_effect: Arrythmias. Tremors, Palpitation, restlessness, nervousness, throat irritation and ankle edema. Tremor, muscle cramps, headache, hypokalaemia.

indications: Treatment of postmenopausal osteoporosis. Pagets disease of bone. Corticosteroid-induced osteoporosis.
contraindications: Hypocalcemia and hypersensitivity. Hypocalcaemia, causes of oesteoporosis.Patient with esophageal abnormalities. Contraindicated during pregnancy and lactation. Contraindicated to paediatrics.
caution: Patient with acute upper gastrointestinal problem.
name: Alendronate
side_effect: Abdominal pain, nausea, dyspepsia, constipation, diarrhoea, oesophageal ulcer, faltulence, acid regurgitation, vomiting, dysphalgia, abnormal distention, headache, musculoskeletal pain. Decrease in serum phosphate.

indications: Treatment of postmenopausal osteoporosis. Pagets disease of bone. Corticosteroid-induced osteoporosis.
contraindications: Hypocalcemia and hypersensitivity. Hypocalcaemia, causes of oesteoporosis.Patient with esophageal abnormalities. Contraindicated during pregnancy and lactation. Contraindicated to paediatrics.
caution: Patient with acute upper gastrointestinal problem.
name: Alendronate Sodium
side_effect: Abdominal pain, nausea, dyspepsia, constipation, diarrhoea, oesophageal ulcer, faltulence, acid regurgitation, vomiting, dysphalgia, abnormal distention, headache, musculoskeletal pain. Decrease in serum phosphate.

indications: Treatment of postmenopausal osteoporosis. Pagets disease of bone. Corticosteroid-induced osteoporosis.
contraindications: Hypocalcemia and hypersensitivity. Hypocalcaemia, causes of oesteoporosis.Patient with esophageal abnormalities. Contraindicated during pregnancy and lactation. Contraindicated to paediatrics.
caution: Patient with acute upper gastrointestinal problem.
name: Alendronic Acid
side_effect: Abdominal pain, nausea, dyspepsia, constipation, diarrhoea, oesophageal ulcer, faltulence, acid regurgitation, vomiting, dysphalgia, abnormal distention, headache, musculoskeletal pain. Decrease in serum phosphate.

indications: Severe falciparum malaria, cerebral malaria, multidrug resistant malaria.
contraindications: Contraindicated during pregnancy.
caution: Avoid concomitant use of drugs known to prolong QT interval, renal/hepatic disease. Avoid combination with pyrimethamine/sulphadoxine.
name: Alfa-beta Arteether
side_effect: Decrease in reticulocyte count, slight rise of ALAT and ASAT may occur.

indications: Managing hypocalcemia in patients undergoing dialysia for chronic renal failure. Renal osteodystrophy. Hypocalaemia and Hyperphosphataemia. Vitamin D dependent rickets, renal tubular osteomalacia.
contraindications: Hypercalcemia, evidence of Vitamin D toxicity, malabsorption syndrome, hypervitaminosis D, abnormal sensitivity to the effects of Vitamin D, decreased renal function. Contraindicated during pregnancy and lactation.
caution: Pediatric doses must be individualized and monitored under close medical supervision, Idiopathic hypercalcemia, renal function impairment. Coronary disease renal function impairment and arteriosclerois, especially in the elderly. Hypoparathyroidism.
name: Alfacalcidol
side_effect: Dry mouth, muscle pain, polydipsia, anorexia, reversible azotemia, vomiting, pancreatitis, mild acidosis, metallic taste, rhinorrhea.

indications: Benign prostatic hyperplasia.
contraindications: Renal insufficiency. Prolong QT interval.
caution: Not to be taken with drugs which prolong QT interval.
name: Alfuzosin
side_effect: Postural hypotension and dizziness. Upper respiratory tract infection. Headache and fatique.

indications: Abrasions, fissures and infections of the nipple, massaging of flat or inverted nipples.
contraindications: Acute mastitis or breast abscess.
caution: In case of excessive tenderness or irritation of any kind, discontinue and consult.
name: Allantoin

indications: Chronic gout. Secondary hyperuricaemia due to cancer, chemotherapy, radiation and thiazides or drugs, prevention of uric acid nephropathy. Calcium renal lithiasis.
contraindications: Children. Acute goat. Contraindicated during pregnancy.
caution: Both allopurinol and uricosurics should not be started during acute attack of goat. Iron therapy not advised with allopurinol. Renal or hepatic impairment. Maintain adequate fluid intake.
name: Allopurinol
side_effect: Rashes, fever, malaise, muscle pain, gastric irritation, headache, nausea, liver damage.

indications: As contraceptive. Hormone replacement therapy (HRT). Dysfunctional uterine bleeding. Endrometriosis. Premenstrual syndrome/tension. Threatened/habitual abortion. Endometrial carcinoma. Dysmenorrhea. Suppression of postpartum lactation. Hypoventilation.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity.Undiagnosed vaginal bleeding, breast cancer, pregnancy, lactation. Thromboembolic disorders. History of seizures. Markedly impaired liver functions.
caution: Diabetes. Exclude pregnancy. Suspicion of thromboembolic disorders.
name: 17 Alpha Hydroxyprogestrone
side_effect: Breast engorgement, headache, rise in body temperature, edema, esophageal reflux, acne and mood swings may occur. Irregular bleeding or amenorrhoea. Long term use of progestin in HRT may increase the risk of breast cancer. Blood sugar may rise and diabetes may be precipitated by long-term use of potent agents like levonorgestrel. Given in early pregnancy, progestins can cause masculinization of female foetus and other congenital abnormalities.

indications: Chemical sunscreens are used as adjuncts in vitiligo therapy, drug induced phototoxicity and to facilitate tanning while preventing sunburn. There is some evidence that they can prevent skin cancer and premature ageing of skin.
name: 4 Aminobenzoic Acid

indications: Mild to moderate ulcerative colitis and maintenance of remission.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity. Severe hepatic or renal impairment. Children below the age of two years.
caution: Elderly, active peptic ulcer, pregnancy, lactation, patients predisposed to pericarditis or myocariditis.
name: 5 Aminosalicylic Acid
side_effect: Headache, nausea, flu, fatigue, fever, rash, sore throat, diarrhoea, joint pain, dizziness, back pain, haemorrhoids, itching, hair loss, intolerance syndrome, peripheral oedema, pancreatitis, nephritis, hepatitis, lupus like syndrome.

indications: Malignant neoplasms of breast. Colon. Urinary bladder. Liver, pancreas adjuvant to surgery, radiotherapy and other chemotherapeutic drugs. Topical application in cutaneous basal cell carcinoma.
contraindications: Depressed bone marrow function. Serious infections. Poor nutritional state. Pregnancy, lactation and children.
caution: Careful care at some hospital or nursing home must for first course of treatment.
name: 5-Fluorouracil
side_effect: Toxicity on bone marrow and GIT, nausea, vomiting. Skin pigmentation.

indications: G6-PD deficiency, Acanthocytosis. Retrolental fibroplasia in premature infants exposed to high oxygen concentrations. Intermittant claudication, fibrocystic breast disease and nocturnal muscle cramps. Supplementation in cystic fibrosis. Abetalipoproteinaemia. Enhances Vit A absorption.
name: A-tocopherol
side_effect: Creatinuria. Impaired wound healing. Abdominal cramps, loose motions and lethargy.

indications: In combination with other antiretroviral agents for the treatment of HIV-1 infections.
contraindications: It has been associated with fatal hypersensitivity reckoners hence should not be restarted after any hypersensitivity reaction occuring with abacavir.
caution: Should always be used in combination with other antiretroviral agents.
name: Abacavir
side_effect: Hypersensitivity reactions (fever, skin, rash, fatique, nausea, vomiting, diarrhoea or abdominal pain pharyngitis, dyspnoea or cough).

indications: Platelet aggregation inhibition as adjunct to percutaneous transluminal coronary angioplasty or atherectomy (PTCA).
contraindications: Active internal bleeding (within 6 weeks), GI or GE bleeding of clinical significance, history of cerebrovascular accident (CVA) within 2 years or CVA with a significant neurological deficit, bleeding diathesis, administration of oral anticoagulant within 7 days unless prothrombin time is less than 1.2 times control, thrombocytopenia, recent major surgery or trauma, intracranial neoplasm, severe uncontrolled hypertension, presumed or documented history of vaculitis.
caution: Free plasma concentration of the drug decreases rapidly with an initial half life of less than 10 min. and a second phase half life of 30 minutes. Platelet function recovers over the course of 48 hours.
name: Abciximab
side_effect: Constipation, ileus, bleeding, thrombocytopenia, atrial fibrillation/flutter, complete AV block, palpitation, SVT, abnormal thinking, dizziness human antichimeric antibody development.

indications: Alcohol deaddiction.
contraindications: Kidney disorder.
name: Acamprosate Calcium
side_effect: Diarrhoea, allergic reactions, irregular heart beat, blood pressure fluctuations, headache, insominia, impotence.

indications: First line therapy in NIDDM after diet has proved insufficient and as an adjunct to existing conventional oral therapy where glycaemic control is inadequate.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity. Diabetic ketoacidosis or cirrhosis, inflammatory bowel disease, colonic ulceration, partial intestinal obstruction, chronic intestinal diseases associated with marked disorders of digestion or absorption and in those who have conditions that may deteriorate as a result of increased gas formation in the intestine. Pregnancy, lactation and children.
caution: On combination with sulphonylurea, acarbose may increase the hypoglycaemia potential of the sulphonylurea.
name: Acarbose
side_effect: Gastrointestinal tract symptoms, abdominal pain, diarrhoea tended to return to pretreatment levels, antacids (aluminium, magnesium salts) have not been shown to ameliorate acute gastrointestinal symptoms of acarbose.

indications: Acute and chronic bronchitis. Bronchial asthma. Sinusitis. Dried rhinitis.
name: Acebrophylline
side_effect: Epigastric pain.

indications: For the relief of pain and inflammation in osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis and ankylosing spondylitis.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity. GI bleeding. Moderate to severe renal impairment. Last three months of pregnancy.
caution: Patients with GI disease, history of peptic ulceration, cerebrovascular bleeding, ulcerative colitis. Crohns disease, systemic lupus erythmatosus, porphyria, haematopoietic or coagulation disorders. The dose should be reduced in patients with mild to moderate hepatic, renal or cardiac function impairment.
name: Aceclofenac
side_effect: Indigestion, heartburn, dyspepsia, diarrhoea, nausea, abdominal pain and flatulence.

indications: For the relief of pain and inflammation in osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis and ankylosing spondylitis.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity. GI bleeding. Moderate to severe renal impairment. Last three months of pregnancy.
caution: Patients with GI disease, history of peptic ulceration, cerebrovascular bleeding, ulcerative colitis. Crohns disease, systemic lupus erythmatosus, porphyria, haematopoietic or coagulation disorders. The dose should be reduced in patients with mild to moderate hepatic, renal or cardiac function impairment.
name: Aceclofenac Sodium
side_effect: Indigestion, heartburn, dyspepsia, diarrhoea, nausea, abdominal pain and flatulence.

indications: Venous thrombosis. Pulmonary embolism. Atrial fibrillation with embolisation.
contraindications: Hepatic of renal impairment. History of peptic ulcer. Cerebrovascular haemorrhage. Pregnancy and lactation.
caution: Hypertension, weight changes, elderly acute illness, Vit K deficiency.
name: Acenocoumarol
side_effect: Rash, fever, diarrhoea, alopecia, agranulocytosis, hepatitis.

indications: Analgesic and antipyretic.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity. Severe hepatic impairment.
caution: Alcoholism - G6PD deficiency. Renal or hepatic impairment.
name: Acetaminophen
side_effect: Nausea, rashes, liver toxicity. Leukopenia is rare. Acute renal tubular necrosis. Very rare, blood dyscrasias.

indications: Epilepsy, adjunct in treatment of oedema due to CHF. Open angle, secondary acute angle closure glaucoma.
contraindications: Liver disease (may precipitate hepatic come). Pregnancy. Adrenal insufficiency. Sodium or potassium depletion. Renal hyper-chloraemic acidosis, prolong therapy in chronic non-congestive angle closure glaucoma.
caution: Gout, diabetes, potassium supplements may be required.
name: Acetazolamide
side_effect: Acidosis, hypokalemia, drowsiness, paresthesias. Hypersensitivity reactions, fever, rashes.

indications: The only use of Vit K is in prophylaxis and treatment of bleeding due to deficiency of clotting factors in the following situations: Dietary deficiency. Prolonged antimicrobial therapy. Obstructive jaundice or malabsorption syndromes. Liver disease. Newborns: Menadione (Vit K3) should not be used for this purpose. Overdose of oralanticoagulants. Prolonged high dose salicylate therapy causes hypoprothrombinemia.
caution: Manadione and its water soluble derivatives can cause haemolysis in patients with G6PD deficiency and neonates. It is not advised to use Menadione because of poor efficacy and higher toxicity.
name: Acetomenaphtone
side_effect: Rapid i.v. injection of emulsified Vit K produced flushing, breathlessness, a sense of constriction in the chest, fall in BP, few deaths are on record.

indications: Prophylaxis in cases of increased risk of blood clotting. Myocardial infarction, coronary bypass, transluminal angioplasty, strokes, transient ischaemic attack. Analgesic (Headache, backache, myalgia, joint pain, toothache, neuralgias, dysmenorrhoea). Antipyretic.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity, haemophilia, hypoprothrombinaemia, platelet disorders, active peptic ulceration and other bleeding disorders. Children suffering from chicken pox or influenza. Avoided in diabetics and injuvenile rheumatoid arthritis and should be stopped before surgery. Contraindicated during pregnancy. Contraindicated below the age of twelve years.
caution: May precipitate bronchospasm and induce asthmatic attacks in susceptible subjects. Gastrointestinal haemorrhage. Gout.
name: Acetyl Salicylic Acid
side_effect: G.I. discomfort, nausea, vomiting. Epigastric distress, occult blood loss in stools, dizziness, tinnitus, vertigo, impairment of hearing and vision, excitement and mental confusion, hyperventilation and electrolyte imbalance. Drug interaction following concurrent use of aspirin with heparin, coumarin or corticoid derivatives, methotrexate, sulfonylureas, probenecid and sulfinpyrazone and spironolactone. It potentiates antiplatelet action of dipridamole.

indications: Tear deficiency. Acute cough associated with excessive or viscous mucus. Paracetamol poisoning.
contraindications: Contraindicated during pregnancy and lactation.
caution: Asthmatic patients, history of bronchospasm, peptic ulceration.
name: Acetylcysteine
side_effect: Flushing, fever, stomatitis, nausea, vomiting, rhinorrhoea, bronchospasm, anaphylactoid reactions, rashes. Rarely blurred vision, bradycardia, syncope, thrombocytopenia, convulsions. Rarely, resp or cardiac arrest.

indications: Severe recalcitrant psoriasis, cutaneous T-cell lymphoma, ichthyosiform erythroderma, keratosis, folliculosis, lamellar ichthyosis, linchen planus.
contraindications: Pancreatitis, disease of liver, renal disease, skeletal hyperostosis, premature epiphyseal colosure, hypertriglyceridemia. Contraindicated during pregnancy and lactation.
caution: Liver enzyme and serum lipids must be checked periodically. Women of child bearing age must wait at least three years for conception after completing acitretin treatment.
name: Acitretin
side_effect: Most frequent side effects are alopecia, arthralgia, ceruminosis, cheilosis, dry eye and nose, eyelid dermatitis, gingivitis, headache, hypertonia, myalgia, nausea, polydipsia, pruritus of skin, rhinitis, skin photosensitivity, skin scaling of feet and hands, spinal hyperostosis, stomatitis, vomiting.

indications: Treatment of acute non-lymphocytic leukemia which has not responded to earlier treatments.
contraindications: Pregnancy, simultaneously administration with radio therapy, myelosuppression and history of allergy.
caution: Renal, hepatic and cardiac function monitoring. Repeated blood counts and uric acid estimation. Special precuation while handling the drug.
name: Aclarubicin
side_effect: Diarrhoea, red colouration of urine, phlebitis, hair loss, nausea, vomiting, myelosuppression, cardiotoxicity, mucositis and oeseophagitis.

indications: GI tract: To relieve flatulence, to prevent gastroesophageal reflux. Eye (as silicon oil): Retinal detachments and contact lenses. medical devices to elastomers, rhampoos. Topical use for prevention, maceration and excoriation of skin, bedsores, ulcers and burns. Use in medical devices to elastomers, rhampoos.
contraindications: Topical Use - Hypersensitivity.
caution: Infantile colic.
name: Activated Dimethicone
side_effect: Eye: Cataract, corneal decompensation, glaucoma, pupillary block, keratopathy iritis and endophthalmitis. Topical use: Itching, burning, sensation and rashes.

indications: GI tract: To relieve flatulence, to prevent gastroesophageal reflux. Eye (as silicon oil): Retinal detachments and contact lenses. medical devices to elastomers, rhampoos. Topical use for prevention, maceration and excoriation of skin, bedsores, ulcers and burns. Use in medical devices to elastomers, rhampoos.
contraindications: Topical Use - Hypersensitivity.
caution: Infantile colic.
name: Activated Dimethyl Polysiloxane
side_effect: Eye: Cataract, corneal decompensation, glaucoma, pupillary block, keratopathy iritis and endophthalmitis. Topical use: Itching, burning, sensation and rashes.

caution: Infantile colic.
name: Activated Methyl Polysiloxane
side_effect: Eye: Cataract, corneal decompensation, glaucoma, pupillary block, keratopathy iritis and endophthalmitis. Topical use: Itching, burning, sensation and rashes.

indications: GI tract: To relieve flatulence, to prevent gastroesophageal reflux. Eye (as silicon oil): Retinal detachments and contact lenses. medical devices to elastomers, rhampoos. caution: Infantile colic.
name: Activated Poly Di Methyl Siloxane
side_effect: Eye: Cataract, corneal decompensation, glaucoma, pupillary block, keratopathy iritis and endophthalmitis. Topical use: Itching, burning, sensation and rashes.

indications: GI tract: To relieve flatulence, to prevent gastroesophageal reflux. Eye (as silicon oil): Retinal detachments and contact lenses. medical devices to elastomers, rhampoos. Topical use for prevention, maceration and excoriation of skin, bedsores, ulcers and burns. Use in medical devices to elastomers, rhampoos.
contraindications: Topical Use - Hypersensitivity.
caution: Infantile colic.
name: Activated Poly Methylsiloxane
side_effect: Eye: Cataract, corneal decompensation, glaucoma, pupillary block, keratopathy iritis and endophthalmitis. Topical use: Itching, burning, sensation and rashes.

indications: Genital herpes Simplex. Mucocutaneous H Simplex, H simplex encephalitis, H Simplex keratitis, Herpes zoster, Chicken pox. Ophthalmic ointment is useful for the treatment of keratitis caused by Herpes simplex virus. Infections of skin caused by Herpes simplex virus. This includes initial and recurrent genital herpes and herpes labialis.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity, glaucoma, psychiatric diseases, depression. Contraindicated below the age of two years. Contraindicated during pregnancy and lactation.
caution: Renal impairment necessitates dose reduction. Maintain adequate hydration. Do not use skin ointment for ophthalmic purpose. Not for buccal or vaginal mucous membranes. A care is necessary to avoid accidental introduction into eye. Poor renal functions.
name: Acyclovir
side_effect: Orally causes headache, nausea, CNS effects, intravenously causes sweating, emesis and fall in BP, dose dependent decrease in GFR reversible neurological manifestations. Transient mild stinging may occur in eyes. Local irritation, transient burning.

indications: Acne vulgaris.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity.
caution: Minimal exposure to sunlight, including sunlamps. Avoid contacts with the eyes, lips, nose, and mucous membranes. The product should not be applied to cuts, abrasion, eczematous skin, or sunburned skin.
name: Adapalene
side_effect: Erythema, scaling, dryness, pruritus and burning.

indications: HBe-Ag positive chronic hepatitis, Lamivudine resistant HBV-HIV co-infection, Lamivudine resistant pre-transplant and post-transplant hepatitis B with decompensated liver disease.
caution: Symptoms of Hepatitis B may worsen if adefovir is stopped suddenly. Monitor kidney functions. Test for HIV before starting treatment with adefovir.
name: Adefovir Dipivoxil
side_effect: Pharyngitis, headache, asthenia, abdominal pain, flu like syndrome and nausea.

indications: Treatment of paroxysmal supraventricular tachycardia. Diagnosis of re-entrant atrial and ventricular tachycardia.
contraindications: Second or third degree AV block, sick sinus syndrome, Bronchial asthma.
caution: Patient with atrial fibrillation/flutter and an accessory bypass tract may develop increased conduction down the anomalous pathway.
name: Adenosine
side_effect: Facial flush, dyspnoea, nausea and light headache occur commonly. Rarely sweating, palpitations, heaviness in arms.

indications: Vitamin B12 deficiency. Neuropathies, psychiatrics disorders, cutaneous sarcoid. Tobacco amblyopia - hydroxocobalamin is of some benefit.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity.
name: Adenosylcobalamin

indications: Acute asthma. Anaphylactic shock. Advanced cardiac life support. Ocular hypertension. Open angle glaucoma.
contraindications: Preexisting hypertension, occlusive vascular disease, angle-closure glaucoma, hypersensitivity, cardiac arrhythmias or tachycardia. Adr should not be given during anaesthesia with halothane to patients receiving Beta blockers.
caution: CV diseases, hyperthyroidism, DM, Parkinsons disease, elderly, pregnancy and lactation.
name: Adrenaline
side_effect: Transient restlessness, palpitation, anxiety, tremor, pallor. Marked rise in BP, ventricular tachycardia/fibrillation, angina, myocardial infarction.

indications: Acute asthma. Anaphylactic shock. Advanced cardiac life support. Ocular hypertension. Open angle glaucoma.
contraindications: Preexisting hypertension, occlusive vascular disease, angle-closure glaucoma, hypersensitivity, cardiac arrhythmias or tachycardia. Adr should not be given during anaesthesia with halothane to patients receiving Beta blockers.
caution: CV diseases, hyperthyroidism, DM, Parkinsons disease, elderly, pregnancy and lactation.
name: Adrenaline Bitartrate
side_effect: Transient restlessness, palpitation, anxiety, tremor, pallor. Marked rise in BP, ventricular tachycardia/fibrillation, angina, myocardial infarction.

indications: Epistaxis, haematuria, retinal haemorrhage, secondary haemorrhage from wounds, etc.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity.
caution: Pregnancy, lactation, children and elderly.
name: Adrenochrome Monosemicarbazone

indications: Ascaris, hookworm, enterobius and trichuris. Tapeworms and strongyloidosis. Trichinosis. Neurocysticercosis. Cutaneous larva migrans. Hydatid disease. Filariasis.
contraindications: Hepatic impairment. Pregnancy, lactation and children below the age of one year.
caution: Renal impairment. Administer within 7 days of start of normal menstruatiohn in women of childbearing age. Adequate nonhormonal contraceptive measures must be taken during and for one month after therapy,
name: Albendazole
side_effect: GI disorders. Headache, nausea, dizziness, allergic reactions, pruritus, alopecia and dry mouth. Bone marrow depression.

indications: Reversible airways obstruction. Premature labour.
contraindications: Cardiovascular disease. Eclampsia and severe pre-eclampsia, intra-uterine infection, intra-uterine foetal death, antepartum haemorrhage, placenta praevia and cord compression, threatened miscarriage, cardiac disease.
caution: Hypertensive ischaemic heart disease. Receiving digitalis.
name: Albuterol
side_effect: Arrythmias. Tremors, Palpitation, restlessness, nervousness, throat irritation and ankle edema. Tremor, muscle cramps, headache, hypokalaemia.

contraindications: Hypersensitivity. Severe hepatic or renal impairment. Children below the age of two years.
caution: Elderly, active peptic ulcer, pregnancy, lactation, patients predisposed to pericarditis or myocariditis.
name: 5 Aminosalicylic Acid
side_effect: Headache, nausea, flu, fatigue, fever, rash, sore throat, diarrhoea, joint pain, dizziness, back pain, haemorrhoids, itching, hair loss, intolerance syndrome, peripheral oedema, pancreatitis, nephritis, hepatitis, lupus like syndrome.

indications: Malignant neoplasms of breast. Colon. Urinary bladder. Liver, pancreas adjuvant to surgery, radiotherapy and other chemotherapeutic drugs. Topical application in cutaneous basal cell carcinoma.
contraindications: Depressed bone marrow function. Serious infections. Poor nutritional state. Pregnancy, lactation and children.
caution: Careful care at some hospital or nursing home must for first course of treatment.
name: 5-Fluorouracil
side_effect: Toxicity on bone marrow and GIT, nausea, vomiting. Skin pigmentation.

indications: G6-PD deficiency, Acanthocytosis. Retrolental fibroplasia in premature infants exposed to high oxygen concentrations. Intermittant claudication, fibrocystic breast disease and nocturnal muscle cramps. Supplementation in cystic fibrosis. Abetalipoproteinaemia. Enhances Vit A absorption.
name: A-tocopherol
side_effect: Creatinuria. Impaired wound healing. Abdominal cramps, loose motions and lethargy.

indications: In combination with other antiretroviral agents for the treatment of HIV-1 infections.
contraindications: It has been associated with fatal hypersensitivity reckoners hence should not be restarted after any hypersensitivity reaction occuring with abacavir.
caution: Should always be used in combination with other antiretroviral agents.
name: Abacavir
side_effect: Hypersensitivity reactions (fever, skin, rash, fatique, nausea, vomiting, diarrhoea or abdominal pain pharyngitis, dyspnoea or cough).

indications: Platelet aggregation inhibition as adjunct to percutaneous transluminal coronary angioplasty or atherectomy (PTCA).
contraindications: Active internal bleeding (within 6 weeks), GI or GE bleeding of clinical significance, history of cerebrovascular accident (CVA) within 2 years or CVA with a significant neurological deficit, bleeding diathesis, administration of oral anticoagulant within 7 days unless prothrombin time is less than 1.2 times control, thrombocytopenia, recent major surgery or trauma, intracranial neoplasm, severe uncontrolled hypertension, presumed or documented history of vaculitis.
caution: Free plasma concentration of the drug decreases rapidly with an initial half life of less than 10 min. and a second phase half life of 30 minutes. Platelet function recovers over the course of 48 hours.
name: Abciximab
side_effect: Constipation, ileus, bleeding, thrombocytopenia, atrial fibrillation/flutter, complete AV block, palpitation, SVT, abnormal thinking, dizziness human antichimeric antibody development.

indications: Alcohol deaddiction.
contraindications: Kidney disorder.
name: Acamprosate Calcium
side_effect: Diarrhoea, allergic reactions, irregular heart beat, blood pressure fluctuations, headache, insominia, impotence.

indications: First line therapy in NIDDM after diet has proved insufficient and as an adjunct to existing conventional oral therapy where glycaemic control is inadequate.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity. Diabetic ketoacidosis or cirrhosis, inflammatory bowel disease, colonic ulceration, partial intestinal obstruction, chronic intestinal diseases associated with marked disorders of digestion or absorption and in those who have conditions that may deteriorate as a result of increased gas formation in the intestine. Pregnancy, lactation and children.
caution: On combination with sulphonylurea, acarbose may increase the hypoglycaemia potential of the sulphonylurea.
name: Acarbose
side_effect: Gastrointestinal tract symptoms, abdominal pain, diarrhoea tended to return to pretreatment levels, antacids (aluminium, magnesium salts) have not been shown to ameliorate acute gastrointestinal symptoms of acarbose.

indications: Acute and chronic bronchitis. Bronchial asthma. Sinusitis. Dried rhinitis.
name: Acebrophylline
side_effect: Epigastric pain.

indications: For the relief of pain and inflammation in osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis and ankylosing spondylitis.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity. GI bleeding. Moderate to severe renal impairment. Last three months of pregnancy.
caution: Patients with GI disease, history of peptic ulceration, cerebrovascular bleeding, ulcerative colitis. Crohns disease, systemic lupus erythmatosus, porphyria, haematopoietic or coagulation disorders. The dose should be reduced in patients with mild to moderate hepatic, renal or cardiac function impairment.
name: Aceclofenac
side_effect: Indigestion, heartburn, dyspepsia, diarrhoea, nausea, abdominal pain and flatulence.

indications: For the relief of pain and inflammation in osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis and ankylosing spondylitis.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity. GI bleeding. Moderate to severe renal impairment. Last three months of pregnancy.
caution: Patients with GI disease, history of peptic ulceration, cerebrovascular bleeding, ulcerative colitis. Crohns disease, systemic lupus erythmatosus, porphyria, haematopoietic or coagulation disorders. The dose should be reduced in patients with mild to moderate hepatic, renal or cardiac function impairment.
name: Aceclofenac Sodium
side_effect: Indigestion, heartburn, dyspepsia, diarrhoea, nausea, abdominal pain and flatulence.

indications: Venous thrombosis. Pulmonary embolism. Atrial fibrillation with embolisation.
contraindications: Hepatic of renal impairment. History of peptic ulcer. Cerebrovascular haemorrhage. Pregnancy and lactation.
caution: Hypertension, weight changes, elderly acute illness, Vit K deficiency.
name: Acenocoumarol
side_effect: Rash, fever, diarrhoea, alopecia, agranulocytosis, hepatitis.

indications: Analgesic and antipyretic.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity. Severe hepatic impairment.
caution: Alcoholism - G6PD deficiency. Renal or hepatic impairment.
name: Acetaminophen
side_effect: Nausea, rashes, liver toxicity. Leukopenia is rare. Acute renal tubular necrosis. Very rare, blood dyscrasias.

indications: Epilepsy, adjunct in treatment of oedema due to CHF. Open angle, secondary acute angle closure glaucoma.
contraindications: Liver disease (may precipitate hepatic come). Pregnancy. Adrenal insufficiency. Sodium or potassium depletion. Renal hyper-chloraemic acidosis, prolong therapy in chronic non-congestive angle closure glaucoma.
caution: Gout, diabetes, potassium supplements may be required.
name: Acetazolamide
side_effect: Acidosis, hypokalemia, drowsiness, paresthesias. Hypersensitivity reactions, fever, rashes.

indications: The only use of Vit K is in prophylaxis and treatment of bleeding due to deficiency of clotting factors in the following situations: Dietary deficiency. Prolonged antimicrobial therapy. Obstructive jaundice or malabsorption syndromes. Liver disease. Newborns: Menadione (Vit K3) should not be used for this purpose. Overdose of oralanticoagulants. Prolonged high dose salicylate therapy causes hypoprothrombinemia.
caution: Manadione and its water soluble derivatives can cause haemolysis in patients with G6PD deficiency and neonates. It is not advised to use Menadione because of poor efficacy and higher toxicity.
name: Acetomenaphtone
side_effect: Rapid i.v. injection of emulsified Vit K produced flushing, breathlessness, a sense of constriction in the chest, fall in BP, few deaths are on record.

indications: Prophylaxis in cases of increased risk of blood clotting. Myocardial infarction, coronary bypass, transluminal angioplasty, strokes, transient ischaemic attack. Analgesic (Headache, backache, myalgia, joint pain, toothache, neuralgias, dysmenorrhoea). Antipyretic.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity, haemophilia, hypoprothrombinaemia, platelet disorders, active peptic ulceration and other bleeding disorders. Children suffering from chicken pox or influenza. Avoided in diabetics and injuvenile rheumatoid arthritis and should be stopped before surgery. Contraindicated during pregnancy. Contraindicated below the age of twelve years.
caution: May precipitate bronchospasm and induce asthmatic attacks in susceptible subjects. Gastrointestinal haemorrhage. Gout.
name: Acetyl Salicylic Acid
side_effect: G.I. discomfort, nausea, vomiting. Epigastric distress, occult blood loss in stools, dizziness, tinnitus, vertigo, impairment of hearing and vision, excitement and mental confusion, hyperventilation and electrolyte imbalance. Drug interaction following concurrent use of aspirin with heparin, coumarin or corticoid derivatives, methotrexate, sulfonylureas, probenecid and sulfinpyrazone and spironolactone. It potentiates antiplatelet action of dipridamole.

indications: Tear deficiency. Acute cough associated with excessive or viscous mucus. Paracetamol poisoning.
contraindications: Contraindicated during pregnancy and lactation.
caution: Asthmatic patients, history of bronchospasm, peptic ulceration.
name: Acetylcysteine
side_effect: Flushing, fever, stomatitis, nausea, vomiting, rhinorrhoea, bronchospasm, anaphylactoid reactions, rashes. Rarely blurred vision, bradycardia, syncope, thrombocytopenia, convulsions. Rarely, resp or cardiac arrest.

indications: Severe recalcitrant psoriasis, cutaneous T-cell lymphoma, ichthyosiform erythroderma, keratosis, folliculosis, lamellar ichthyosis, linchen planus.
contraindications: Pancreatitis, disease of liver, renal disease, skeletal hyperostosis, premature epiphyseal colosure, hypertriglyceridemia. Contraindicated during pregnancy and lactation.
caution: Liver enzyme and serum lipids must be checked periodically. Women of child bearing age must wait at least three years for conception after completing acitretin treatment.
name: Acitretin
side_effect: Most frequent side effects are alopecia, arthralgia, ceruminosis, cheilosis, dry eye and nose, eyelid dermatitis, gingivitis, headache, hypertonia, myalgia, nausea, polydipsia, pruritus of skin, rhinitis, skin photosensitivity, skin scaling of feet and hands, spinal hyperostosis, stomatitis, vomiting.

indications: Treatment of acute non-lymphocytic leukemia which has not responded to earlier treatments.
contraindications: Pregnancy, simultaneously administration with radio therapy, myelosuppression and history of allergy.
caution: Renal, hepatic and cardiac function monitoring. Repeated blood counts and uric acid estimation. Special precuation while handling the drug.
name: Aclarubicin
side_effect: Diarrhoea, red colouration of urine, phlebitis, hair loss, nausea, vomiting, myelosuppression, cardiotoxicity, mucositis and oeseophagitis.

indications: GI tract: To relieve flatulence, to prevent gastroesophageal reflux. Eye (as silicon oil): Retinal detachments and contact lenses. medical devices to elastomers, rhampoos. Topical use for prevention, maceration and excoriation of skin, bedsores, ulcers and burns. Use in medical devices to elastomers, rhampoos.
contraindications: Topical Use - Hypersensitivity.
caution: Infantile colic.
name: Activated Dimethicone
side_effect: Eye: Cataract, corneal decompensation, glaucoma, pupillary block, keratopathy iritis and endophthalmitis. Topical use: Itching, burning, sensation and rashes.

indications: GI tract: To relieve flatulence, to prevent gastroesophageal reflux. Eye (as silicon oil): Retinal detachments and contact lenses. medical devices to elastomers, rhampoos. Topical use for prevention, maceration and excoriation of skin, bedsores, ulcers and burns. Use in medical devices to elastomers, rhampoos.
contraindications: Topical Use - Hypersensitivity.
caution: Infantile colic.
name: Activated Dimethyl Polysiloxane
side_effect: Eye: Cataract, corneal decompensation, glaucoma, pupillary block, keratopathy iritis and endophthalmitis. Topical use: Itching, burning, sensation and rashes.

caution: Infantile colic.
name: Activated Methyl Polysiloxane
side_effect: Eye: Cataract, corneal decompensation, glaucoma, pupillary block, keratopathy iritis and endophthalmitis. Topical use: Itching, burning, sensation and rashes.

side_effect: Eye: Cataract, corneal decompensation, glaucoma, pupillary block, keratopathy iritis and endophthalmitis. Topical use: Itching, burning, sensation and rashes.

indications: GI tract: To relieve flatulence, to prevent gastroesophageal reflux. Eye (as silicon oil): Retinal detachments and contact lenses. medical devices to elastomers, rhampoos. Topical use for prevention, maceration and excoriation of skin, bedsores, ulcers and burns. Use in medical devices to elastomers, rhampoos.
contraindications: Topical Use - Hypersensitivity.
caution: Infantile colic.
name: Activated Poly Methylsiloxane
side_effect: Eye: Cataract, corneal decompensation, glaucoma, pupillary block, keratopathy iritis and endophthalmitis. Topical use: Itching, burning, sensation and rashes.

indications: Genital herpes Simplex. Mucocutaneous H Simplex, H simplex encephalitis, H Simplex keratitis, Herpes zoster, Chicken pox. Ophthalmic ointment is useful for the treatment of keratitis caused by Herpes simplex virus. Infections of skin caused by Herpes simplex virus. This includes initial and recurrent genital herpes and herpes labialis.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity, glaucoma, psychiatric diseases, depression. Contraindicated below the age of two years. Contraindicated during pregnancy and lactation.
caution: Renal impairment necessitates dose reduction. Maintain adequate hydration. Do not use skin ointment for ophthalmic purpose. Not for buccal or vaginal mucous membranes. A care is necessary to avoid accidental introduction into eye. Poor renal functions.
name: Acyclovir
side_effect: Orally causes headache, nausea, CNS effects, intravenously causes sweating, emesis and fall in BP, dose dependent decrease in GFR reversible neurological manifestations. Transient mild stinging may occur in eyes. Local irritation, transient burning.

indications: Acne vulgaris.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity.
caution: Minimal exposure to sunlight, including sunlamps. Avoid contacts with the eyes, lips, nose, and mucous membranes. The product should not be applied to cuts, abrasion, eczematous skin, or sunburned skin.
name: Adapalene
side_effect: Erythema, scaling, dryness, pruritus and burning.

indications: HBe-Ag positive chronic hepatitis, Lamivudine resistant HBV-HIV co-infection, Lamivudine resistant pre-transplant and post-transplant hepatitis B with decompensated liver disease.
caution: Symptoms of Hepatitis B may worsen if adefovir is stopped suddenly. Monitor kidney functions. Test for HIV before starting treatment with adefovir.
name: Adefovir Dipivoxil
side_effect: Pharyngitis, headache, asthenia, abdominal pain, flu like syndrome and nausea.

indications: Treatment of paroxysmal supraventricular tachycardia. Diagnosis of re-entrant atrial and ventricular tachycardia.
contraindications: Second or third degree AV block, sick sinus syndrome, Bronchial asthma.
caution: Patient with atrial fibrillation/flutter and an accessory bypass tract may develop increased conduction down the anomalous pathway.
name: Adenosine
side_effect: Facial flush, dyspnoea, nausea and light headache occur commonly. Rarely sweating, palpitations, heaviness in arms.

indications: Vitamin B12 deficiency. Neuropathies, psychiatrics disorders, cutaneous sarcoid. Tobacco amblyopia - hydroxocobalamin is of some benefit.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity.
name: Adenosylcobalamin

indications: Acute asthma. Anaphylactic shock. Advanced cardiac life support. Ocular hypertension. Open angle glaucoma.
contraindications: Preexisting hypertension, occlusive vascular disease, angle-closure glaucoma, hypersensitivity, cardiac arrhythmias or tachycardia. Adr should not be given during anaesthesia with halothane to patients receiving Beta blockers.
caution: CV diseases, hyperthyroidism, DM, Parkinsons disease, elderly, pregnancy and lactation.
name: Adrenaline
side_effect: Transient restlessness, palpitation, anxiety, tremor, pallor. Marked rise in BP, ventricular tachycardia/fibrillation, angina, myocardial infarction.

indications: Acute asthma. Anaphylactic shock. Advanced cardiac life support. Ocular hypertension. Open angle glaucoma.
contraindications: Preexisting hypertension, occlusive vascular disease, angle-closure glaucoma, hypersensitivity, cardiac arrhythmias or tachycardia. Adr should not be given during anaesthesia with halothane to patients receiving Beta blockers.
caution: CV diseases, hyperthyroidism, DM, Parkinsons disease, elderly, pregnancy and lactation.
name: Adrenaline Bitartrate
side_effect: Transient restlessness, palpitation, anxiety, tremor, pallor. Marked rise in BP, ventricular tachycardia/fibrillation, angina, myocardial infarction.

indications: Epistaxis, haematuria, retinal haemorrhage, secondary haemorrhage from wounds, etc.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity.
caution: Pregnancy, lactation, children and elderly.
name: Adrenochrome Monosemicarbazone

indications: Ascaris, hookworm, enterobius and trichuris. Tapeworms and strongyloidosis. Trichinosis. Neurocysticercosis. Cutaneous larva migrans. Hydatid disease. Filariasis.
contraindications: Hepatic impairment. Pregnancy, lactation and children below the age of one year.
caution: Renal impairment. Administer within 7 days of start of normal menstruatiohn in women of childbearing age. Adequate nonhormonal contraceptive measures must be taken during and for one month after therapy,
name: Albendazole
side_effect: GI disorders. Headache, nausea, dizziness, allergic reactions, pruritus, alopecia and dry mouth. Bone marrow depression.

indications: Reversible airways obstruction. Premature labour.
contraindications: Cardiovascular disease. Eclampsia and severe pre-eclampsia, intra-uterine infection, intra-uterine foetal death, antepartum haemorrhage, placenta praevia and cord compression, threatened miscarriage, cardiac disease.
caution: Hypertensive ischaemic heart disease. Receiving digitalis.
name: Albuterol
side_effect: Arrythmias. Tremors, Palpitation, restlessness, nervousness, throat irritation and ankle edema. Tremor, muscle cramps, headache, hypokalaemia.

indications: Reversible airways obstruction. Premature labour.
contraindications: Cardiovascular disease. Eclampsia and severe pre-eclampsia, intra-uterine infection, intra-uterine foetal death, antepartum haemorrhage, placenta praevia and cord compression, threatened miscarriage, cardiac disease.
caution: Hypertensive ischaemic heart disease. Receiving digitalis.
name: Albuterol Sulphate
side_effect: Arrythmias. Tremors, Palpitation, restlessness, nervousness, throat irritation and ankle edema. Tremor, muscle cramps, headache, hypokalaemia.

indications: Treatment of postmenopausal osteoporosis. Pagets disease of bone. Corticosteroid-induced osteoporosis.
contraindications: Hypocalcemia and hypersensitivity. Hypocalcaemia, causes of oesteoporosis.Patient with esophageal abnormalities. Contraindicated during pregnancy and lactation. Contraindicated to paediatrics.
caution: Patient with acute upper gastrointestinal problem.
name: Alendronate
side_effect: Abdominal pain, nausea, dyspepsia, constipation, diarrhoea, oesophageal ulcer, faltulence, acid regurgitation, vomiting, dysphalgia, abnormal distention, headache, musculoskeletal pain. Decrease in serum phosphate.

indications: Treatment of postmenopausal osteoporosis. Pagets disease of bone. Corticosteroid-induced osteoporosis.
contraindications: Hypocalcemia and hypersensitivity. Hypocalcaemia, causes of oesteoporosis.Patient with esophageal abnormalities. Contraindicated during pregnancy and lactation. Contraindicated to paediatrics.
caution: Patient with acute upper gastrointestinal problem.
name: Alendronate Sodium
side_effect: Abdominal pain, nausea, dyspepsia, constipation, diarrhoea, oesophageal ulcer, faltulence, acid regurgitation, vomiting, dysphalgia, abnormal distention, headache, musculoskeletal pain. Decrease in serum phosphate.

indications: Treatment of postmenopausal osteoporosis. Pagets disease of bone. Corticosteroid-induced osteoporosis.
contraindications: Hypocalcemia and hypersensitivity. Hypocalcaemia, causes of oesteoporosis.Patient with esophageal abnormalities. Contraindicated during pregnancy and lactation. Contraindicated to paediatrics.
caution: Patient with acute upper gastrointestinal problem.
name: Alendronic Acid
side_effect: Abdominal pain, nausea, dyspepsia, constipation, diarrhoea, oesophageal ulcer, faltulence, acid regurgitation, vomiting, dysphalgia, abnormal distention, headache, musculoskeletal pain. Decrease in serum phosphate.

indications: Severe falciparum malaria, cerebral malaria, multidrug resistant malaria.
contraindications: Contraindicated during pregnancy.
caution: Avoid concomitant use of drugs known to prolong QT interval, renal/hepatic disease. Avoid combination with pyrimethamine/sulphadoxine.
name: Alfa-beta Arteether
side_effect: Decrease in reticulocyte count, slight rise of ALAT and ASAT may occur.

indications: Managing hypocalcemia in patients undergoing dialysia for chronic renal failure. Renal osteodystrophy. Hypocalaemia and Hyperphosphataemia. Vitamin D dependent rickets, renal tubular osteomalacia.
contraindications: Hypercalcemia, evidence of Vitamin D toxicity, malabsorption syndrome, hypervitaminosis D, abnormal sensitivity to the effects of Vitamin D, decreased renal function. Contraindicated during pregnancy and lactation.
caution: Pediatric doses must be individualized and monitored under close medical supervision, Idiopathic hypercalcemia, renal function impairment. Coronary disease renal function impairment and arteriosclerois, especially in the elderly. Hypoparathyroidism.
name: Alfacalcidol
side_effect: Dry mouth, muscle pain, polydipsia, anorexia, reversible azotemia, vomiting, pancreatitis, mild acidosis, metallic taste, rhinorrhea.

indications: Benign prostatic hyperplasia.
contraindications: Renal insufficiency. Prolong QT interval.
caution: Not to be taken with drugs which prolong QT interval.
name: Alfuzosin
side_effect: Postural hypotension and dizziness. Upper respiratory tract infection. Headache and fatique.

indications: Abrasions, fissures and infections of the nipple, massaging of flat or inverted nipples.
contraindications: Acute mastitis or breast abscess.
caution: In case of excessive tenderness or irritation of any kind, discontinue and consult.
name: Allantoin

indications: Chronic gout. Secondary hyperuricaemia due to cancer, chemotherapy, radiation and thiazides or drugs, prevention of uric acid nephropathy. Calcium renal lithiasis.
contraindications: Children. Acute goat. Contraindicated during pregnancy.
caution: Both allopurinol and uricosurics should not be started during acute attack of goat. Iron therapy not advised with allopurinol. Renal or hepatic impairment. Maintain adequate fluid intake.
name: Allopurinol
side_effect: Rashes, fever, malaise, muscle pain, gastric irritation, headache, nausea, liver damage.

indications: As contraceptive. Hormone replacement therapy (HRT). Dysfunctional uterine bleeding. Endrometriosis. Premenstrual syndrome/tension. Threatened/habitual abortion. Endometrial carcinoma. Dysmenorrhea. Suppression of postpartum lactation. Hypoventilation.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity.Undiagnosed vaginal bleeding, breast cancer, pregnancy, lactation. Thromboembolic disorders. History of seizures. Markedly impaired liver functions.
caution: Diabetes. Exclude pregnancy. Suspicion of thromboembolic disorders.
name: 17 Alpha Hydroxyprogestrone
side_effect: Breast engorgement, headache, rise in body temperature, edema, esophageal reflux, acne and mood swings may occur. Irregular bleeding or amenorrhoea. Long term use of progestin in HRT may increase the risk of breast cancer. Blood sugar may rise and diabetes may be precipitated by long-term use of potent agents like levonorgestrel. Given in early pregnancy, progestins can cause masculinization of female foetus and other congenital abnormalities.

indications: Chemical sunscreens are used as adjuncts in vitiligo therapy, drug induced phototoxicity and to facilitate tanning while preventing sunburn. There is some evidence that they can prevent skin cancer and premature ageing of skin.
name: 4 Aminobenzoic Acid

indications: Mild to moderate ulcerative colitis and maintenance of remission.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity. Severe hepatic or renal impairment. Children below the age of two years.
caution: Elderly, active peptic ulcer, pregnancy, lactation, patients predisposed to pericarditis or myocariditis.

side_effect: Acidosis, hypokalemia, drowsiness, paresthesias. Hypersensitivity reactions, fever, rashes.

Obstructive jaundice or malabsorption syndromes. Liver disease. Newborns: Menadione (Vit K3) should not be used for this purpose. Overdose of oralanticoagulants. Prolonged high dose salicylate therapy causes hypoprothrombinemia.
caution: Manadione and its water soluble derivatives can cause haemolysis in patients with G6PD deficiency and neonates. It is not advised to use Menadione because of poor efficacy and higher toxicity.
name: Acetomenaphtone
side_effect: Rapid i.v. injection of emulsified Vit K produced flushing, breathlessness, a sense of constriction in the chest, fall in BP, few deaths are on record.

indications: Prophylaxis in cases of increased risk of blood clotting. Myocardial infarction, coronary bypass, transluminal angioplasty, strokes, transient ischaemic attack. Analgesic (Headache, backache, myalgia, joint pain, toothache, neuralgias, dysmenorrhoea). Antipyretic.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity, haemophilia, hypoprothrombinaemia, platelet disorders, active peptic ulceration and other bleeding disorders. Children suffering from chicken pox or influenza. Avoided in diabetics and injuvenile rheumatoid arthritis and should be stopped before surgery. Contraindicated during pregnancy. Contraindicated below the age of twelve years.
caution: May precipitate bronchospasm and induce asthmatic attacks in susceptible subjects. Gastrointestinal haemorrhage. Gout.
name: Acetyl Salicylic Acid
side_effect: G.I. discomfort, nausea, vomiting. Epigastric distress, occult blood loss in stools, dizziness, tinnitus, vertigo, impairment of hearing and vision, excitement and mental confusion, hyperventilation and electrolyte imbalance. Drug interaction following concurrent use of aspirin with heparin, coumarin or corticoid derivatives, methotrexate, sulfonylureas, probenecid and sulfinpyrazone and spironolactone. It potentiates antiplatelet action of dipridamole.

indications: Tear deficiency. Acute cough associated with excessive or viscous mucus. Paracetamol poisoning.
contraindications: Contraindicated during pregnancy and lactation.
caution: Asthmatic patients, history of bronchospasm, peptic ulceration.
name: Acetylcysteine
side_effect: Flushing, fever, stomatitis, nausea, vomiting, rhinorrhoea, bronchospasm, anaphylactoid reactions, rashes. Rarely blurred vision, bradycardia, syncope, thrombocytopenia, convulsions. Rarely, resp or cardiac arrest.

indications: Severe recalcitrant psoriasis, cutaneous T-cell lymphoma, ichthyosiform erythroderma, keratosis, folliculosis, lamellar ichthyosis, linchen planus.
contraindications: Pancreatitis, disease of liver, renal disease, skeletal hyperostosis, premature epiphyseal colosure, hypertriglyceridemia. Contraindicated during pregnancy and lactation.
caution: Liver enzyme and serum lipids must be checked periodically. Women of child bearing age must wait at least three years for conception after completing acitretin treatment.
name: Acitretin
side_effect: Most frequent side effects are alopecia, arthralgia, ceruminosis, cheilosis, dry eye and nose, eyelid dermatitis, gingivitis, headache, hypertonia, myalgia, nausea, polydipsia, pruritus of skin, rhinitis, skin photosensitivity, skin scaling of feet and hands, spinal hyperostosis, stomatitis, vomiting.

indications: Treatment of acute non-lymphocytic leukemia which has not responded to earlier treatments.
contraindications: Pregnancy, simultaneously administration with radio therapy, myelosuppression and history of allergy.
caution: Renal, hepatic and cardiac function monitoring. Repeated blood counts and uric acid estimation. Special precuation while handling the drug.
name: Aclarubicin
side_effect: Diarrhoea, red colouration of urine, phlebitis, hair loss, nausea, vomiting, myelosuppression, cardiotoxicity, mucositis and oeseophagitis.

indications: GI tract: To relieve flatulence, to prevent gastroesophageal reflux. Eye (as silicon oil): Retinal detachments and contact lenses. medical devices to elastomers, rhampoos. Topical use for prevention, maceration and excoriation of skin, bedsores, ulcers and burns. Use in medical devices to elastomers, rhampoos.
contraindications: Topical Use - Hypersensitivity.
caution: Infantile colic.
name: Activated Dimethicone
side_effect: Eye: Cataract, corneal decompensation, glaucoma, pupillary block, keratopathy iritis and endophthalmitis. Topical use: Itching, burning, sensation and rashes.

indications: GI tract: To relieve flatulence, to prevent gastroesophageal reflux. Eye (as silicon oil): Retinal detachments and contact lenses. medical devices to elastomers, rhampoos. contraindications: Topical Use - Hypersensitivity.
caution: Infantile colic.

side_effect: Eye: Cataract, corneal decompensation, glaucoma, pupillary block, keratopathy iritis and endophthalmitis. Topical use: Itching, burning, sensation and rashes.

side_effect: Eye: Cataract, corneal decompensation, glaucoma, pupillary block, keratopathy iritis and endophthalmitis. Topical use: Itching, burning, sensation and rashes.

indications: GI tract: To relieve flatulence, to prevent gastroesophageal reflux. Eye (as silicon oil): Retinal detachments and contact lenses. medical devices to elastomers, rhampoos. Topical use for prevention, maceration and excoriation of skin, bedsores, ulcers and burns. Use in medical devices to elastomers, rhampoos.
contraindications: Topical Use - Hypersensitivity.
caution: Infantile colic.
name: Activated Poly Methylsiloxane
side_effect: Eye: Cataract, corneal decompensation, glaucoma, pupillary block, keratopathy iritis and endophthalmitis. Topical use: Itching, burning, sensation and rashes.

indications: Genital herpes Simplex. Mucocutaneous H Simplex, H simplex encephalitis, H Simplex keratitis, Herpes zoster, Chicken pox. Ophthalmic ointment is useful for the treatment of keratitis caused by Herpes simplex virus. Infections of skin caused by Herpes simplex virus. This includes initial and recurrent genital herpes and herpes labialis.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity, glaucoma, psychiatric diseases, depression. Contraindicated below the age of two years. Contraindicated during pregnancy and lactation.
caution: Renal impairment necessitates dose reduction. Maintain adequate hydration. Do not use skin ointment for ophthalmic purpose. Not for buccal or vaginal mucous membranes. A care is necessary to avoid accidental introduction into eye. Poor renal functions.
name: Acyclovir
side_effect: Orally causes headache, nausea, CNS effects, intravenously causes sweating, emesis and fall in BP, dose dependent decrease in GFR reversible neurological manifestations. Transient mild stinging may occur in eyes. Local irritation, transient burning.

indications: Acne vulgaris.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity.
caution: Minimal exposure to sunlight, including sunlamps. Avoid contacts with the eyes, lips, nose, and mucous membranes. The product should not be applied to cuts, abrasion, eczematous skin, or sunburned skin.
name: Adapalene
side_effect: Erythema, scaling, dryness, pruritus and burning.

indications: HBe-Ag positive chronic hepatitis, Lamivudine resistant HBV-HIV co-infection, Lamivudine resistant pre-transplant and post-transplant hepatitis B with decompensated liver disease.
caution: Symptoms of Hepatitis B may worsen if adefovir is stopped suddenly. Monitor kidney functions. Test for HIV before starting treatment with adefovir.
name: Adefovir Dipivoxil
side_effect: Pharyngitis, headache, asthenia, abdominal pain, flu like syndrome and nausea.

indications: Treatment of paroxysmal supraventricular tachycardia. Diagnosis of re-entrant atrial and ventricular tachycardia.
contraindications: Second or third degree AV block, sick sinus syndrome, Bronchial asthma.
caution: Patient with atrial fibrillation/flutter and an accessory bypass tract may develop increased conduction down the anomalous pathway.
name: Adenosine
side_effect: Facial flush, dyspnoea, nausea and light headache occur commonly. Rarely sweating, palpitations, heaviness in arms.

indications: Vitamin B12 deficiency. Neuropathies, psychiatrics disorders, cutaneous sarcoid. Tobacco amblyopia - hydroxocobalamin is of some benefit.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity.
name: Adenosylcobalamin

indications: Acute asthma. Anaphylactic shock. Advanced cardiac life support. Ocular hypertension. Open angle glaucoma.
contraindications: Preexisting hypertension, occlusive vascular disease, angle-closure glaucoma, hypersensitivity, cardiac arrhythmias or tachycardia. Adr should not be given during anaesthesia with halothane to patients receiving Beta blockers.
caution: CV diseases, hyperthyroidism, DM, Parkinsons disease, elderly, pregnancy and lactation.
name: Adrenaline
side_effect: Transient restlessness, palpitation, anxiety, tremor, pallor. Marked rise in BP, ventricular tachycardia/fibrillation, angina, myocardial infarction.

indications: Acute asthma. Anaphylactic shock. Advanced cardiac life support. Ocular hypertension. Open angle glaucoma.
contraindications: Preexisting hypertension, occlusive vascular disease, angle-closure glaucoma, hypersensitivity, cardiac arrhythmias or tachycardia. Adr should not be given during anaesthesia with halothane to patients receiving Beta blockers.
caution: CV diseases, hyperthyroidism, DM, Parkinsons disease, elderly, pregnancy and lactation.
name: Adrenaline Bitartrate
side_effect: Transient restlessness, palpitation, anxiety, tremor, pallor. Marked rise in BP, ventricular tachycardia/fibrillation, angina, myocardial infarction.

indications: Epistaxis, haematuria, retinal haemorrhage, secondary haemorrhage from wounds, etc.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity.
caution: Pregnancy, lactation, children and elderly.
name: Adrenochrome Monosemicarbazone

indications: Ascaris, hookworm, enterobius and trichuris. Tapeworms and strongyloidosis. Trichinosis. Neurocysticercosis. Cutaneous larva migrans. Hydatid disease. Filariasis.
contraindications: Hepatic impairment. Pregnancy, lactation and children below the age of one year.
caution: Renal impairment. Administer within 7 days of start of normal menstruatiohn in women of childbearing age. Adequate nonhormonal contraceptive measures must be taken during and for one month after therapy,
name: Albendazole
side_effect: GI disorders. Headache, nausea, dizziness, allergic reactions, pruritus, alopecia and dry mouth. Bone marrow depression.

indications: Reversible airways obstruction. Premature labour.
contraindications: Cardiovascular disease. Eclampsia and severe pre-eclampsia, intra-uterine infection, intra-uterine foetal death, antepartum haemorrhage, placenta praevia and cord compression, threatened miscarriage, cardiac disease.
caution: Hypertensive ischaemic heart disease. Receiving digitalis.
name: Albuterol
side_effect: Arrythmias. Tremors, Palpitation, restlessness, nervousness, throat irritation and ankle edema. Tremor, muscle cramps, headache, hypokalaemia.

indications: Reversible airways obstruction. Premature labour.
contraindications: Cardiovascular disease. Eclampsia and severe pre-eclampsia, intra-uterine infection, intra-uterine foetal death, antepartum haemorrhage, placenta praevia and cord compression, threatened miscarriage, cardiac disease.
caution: Hypertensive ischaemic heart disease. Receiving digitalis.
name: Albuterol Sulphate
side_effect: Arrythmias. Tremors, Palpitation, restlessness, nervousness, throat irritation and ankle edema. Tremor, muscle cramps, headache, hypokalaemia.

indications: Treatment of postmenopausal osteoporosis. Pagets disease of bone. Corticosteroid-induced osteoporosis.
contraindications: Hypocalcemia and hypersensitivity. Hypocalcaemia, causes of oesteoporosis.Patient with esophageal abnormalities. Contraindicated during pregnancy and lactation. Contraindicated to paediatrics.
caution: Patient with acute upper gastrointestinal problem.
name: Alendronate
side_effect: Abdominal pain, nausea, dyspepsia, constipation, diarrhoea, oesophageal ulcer, faltulence, acid regurgitation, vomiting, dysphalgia, abnormal distention, headache, musculoskeletal pain. Decrease in serum phosphate.

indications: Treatment of postmenopausal osteoporosis. Pagets disease of bone. Corticosteroid-induced osteoporosis.
contraindications: Hypocalcemia and hypersensitivity. Hypocalcaemia, causes of oesteoporosis.Patient with esophageal abnormalities. Contraindicated during pregnancy and lactation. Contraindicated to paediatrics.
caution: Patient with acute upper gastrointestinal problem.
name: Alendronate Sodium
side_effect: Abdominal pain, nausea, dyspepsia, constipation, diarrhoea, oesophageal ulcer, faltulence, acid regurgitation, vomiting, dysphalgia, abnormal distention, headache, musculoskeletal pain. Decrease in serum phosphate.

indications: Treatment of postmenopausal osteoporosis. Pagets disease of bone. Corticosteroid-induced osteoporosis.
contraindications: Hypocalcemia and hypersensitivity. Hypocalcaemia, causes of oesteoporosis.Patient with esophageal abnormalities. Contraindicated during pregnancy and lactation. Contraindicated to paediatrics.
caution: Patient with acute upper gastrointestinal problem.
name: Alendronic Acid
side_effect: Abdominal pain, nausea, dyspepsia, constipation, diarrhoea, oesophageal ulcer, faltulence, acid regurgitation, vomiting, dysphalgia, abnormal distention, headache, musculoskeletal pain. Decrease in serum phosphate.

indications: Severe falciparum malaria, cerebral malaria, multidrug resistant malaria.
contraindications: Contraindicated during pregnancy.
caution: Avoid concomitant use of drugs known to prolong QT interval, renal/hepatic disease. Avoid combination with pyrimethamine/sulphadoxine.
name: Alfa-beta Arteether
side_effect: Decrease in reticulocyte count, slight rise of ALAT and ASAT may occur.

indications: Managing hypocalcemia in patients undergoing dialysia for chronic renal failure. Renal osteodystrophy. Hypocalaemia and Hyperphosphataemia. Vitamin D dependent rickets, renal tubular osteomalacia.
contraindications: Hypercalcemia, evidence of Vitamin D toxicity, malabsorption syndrome, hypervitaminosis D, abnormal sensitivity to the effects of Vitamin D, decreased renal function. Contraindicated during pregnancy and lactation.
caution: Pediatric doses must be individualized and monitored under close medical supervision, Idiopathic hypercalcemia, renal function impairment. Coronary disease renal function impairment and arteriosclerois, especially in the elderly. Hypoparathyroidism.
name: Alfacalcidol
side_effect: Dry mouth, muscle pain, polydipsia, anorexia, reversible azotemia, vomiting, pancreatitis, mild acidosis, metallic taste, rhinorrhea.

indications: Benign prostatic hyperplasia.
contraindications: Renal insufficiency. Prolong QT interval.
caution: Not to be taken with drugs which prolong QT interval.
name: Alfuzosin
side_effect: Postural hypotension and dizziness. Upper respiratory tract infection. Headache and fatique.

indications: Abrasions, fissures and infections of the nipple, massaging of flat or inverted nipples.
contraindications: Acute mastitis or breast abscess.
caution: In case of excessive tenderness or irritation of any kind, discontinue and consult.
name: Allantoin

indications: Chronic gout. Secondary hyperuricaemia due to cancer, chemotherapy, radiation and thiazides or drugs, prevention of uric acid nephropathy. Calcium renal lithiasis.
contraindications: Children. Acute goat. Contraindicated during pregnancy.
caution: Both allopurinol and uricosurics should not be started during acute attack of goat. Iron therapy not advised with allopurinol. Renal or hepatic impairment. Maintain adequate fluid intake.
name: Allopurinol
side_effect: Rashes, fever, malaise, muscle pain, gastric irritation, headache, nausea, liver damage.

indications: As contraceptive. Hormone replacement therapy (HRT). Dysfunctional uterine bleeding. Endrometriosis. Premenstrual syndrome/tension. Threatened/habitual abortion. Endometrial carcinoma. Dysmenorrhea. Suppression of postpartum lactation. Hypoventilation.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity.Undiagnosed vaginal bleeding, breast cancer, pregnancy, lactation. Thromboembolic disorders. History of seizures. Markedly impaired liver functions.
caution: Diabetes. Exclude pregnancy. Suspicion of thromboembolic disorders.
name: 17 Alpha Hydroxyprogestrone
side_effect: Breast engorgement, headache, rise in body temperature, edema, esophageal reflux, acne and mood swings may occur. Irregular bleeding or amenorrhoea. Long term use of progestin in HRT may increase the risk of breast cancer. Blood sugar may rise and diabetes may be precipitated by long-term use of potent agents like levonorgestrel. Given in early pregnancy, progestins can cause masculinization of female foetus and other congenital abnormalities.

indications: Chemical sunscreens are used as adjuncts in vitiligo therapy, drug induced phototoxicity and to facilitate tanning while preventing sunburn. There is some evidence that they can prevent skin cancer and premature ageing of skin.
name: 4 Aminobenzoic Acid

indications: Mild to moderate ulcerative colitis and maintenance of remission.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity. Severe hepatic or renal impairment. Children below the age of two years.
caution: Elderly, active peptic ulcer, pregnancy, lactation, patients predisposed to pericarditis or myocariditis.
name: 5 Aminosalicylic Acid
side_effect: Headache, nausea, flu, fatigue, fever, rash, sore throat, diarrhoea, joint pain, dizziness, back pain, haemorrhoids, itching, hair loss, intolerance syndrome, peripheral oedema, pancreatitis, nephritis, hepatitis, lupus like syndrome.

indications: Malignant neoplasms of breast. Colon. Urinary bladder. Liver, pancreas adjuvant to surgery, radiotherapy and other chemotherapeutic drugs. Topical application in cutaneous basal cell carcinoma.
contraindications: Depressed bone marrow function. Serious infections. Poor nutritional state. Pregnancy, lactation and children.
caution: Careful care at some hospital or nursing home must for first course of treatment.
name: 5-Fluorouracil
side_effect: Toxicity on bone marrow and GIT, nausea, vomiting. Skin pigmentation.

indications: G6-PD deficiency, Acanthocytosis. Retrolental fibroplasia in premature infants exposed to high oxygen concentrations. Intermittant claudication, fibrocystic breast disease and nocturnal muscle cramps. Supplementation in cystic fibrosis. Abetalipoproteinaemia. Enhances Vit A absorption.
name: A-tocopherol
side_effect: Creatinuria. Impaired wound healing. Abdominal cramps, loose motions and lethargy.

indications: In combination with other antiretroviral agents for the treatment of HIV-1 infections.
contraindications: It has been associated with fatal hypersensitivity reckoners hence should not be restarted after any hypersensitivity reaction occuring with abacavir.
caution: Should always be used in combination with other antiretroviral agents.
name: Abacavir
side_effect: Hypersensitivity reactions (fever, skin, rash, fatique, nausea, vomiting, diarrhoea or abdominal pain pharyngitis, dyspnoea or cough).

indications: Platelet aggregation inhibition as adjunct to percutaneous transluminal coronary angioplasty or atherectomy (PTCA).
contraindications: Active internal bleeding (within 6 weeks), GI or GE bleeding of clinical significance, history of cerebrovascular accident (CVA) within 2 years or CVA with a significant neurological deficit, bleeding diathesis, administration of oral anticoagulant within 7 days unless prothrombin time is less than 1.2 times control, thrombocytopenia, recent major surgery or trauma, intracranial neoplasm, severe uncontrolled hypertension, presumed or documented history of vaculitis.
caution: Free plasma concentration of the drug decreases rapidly with an initial half life of less than 10 min. and a second phase half life of 30 minutes. Platelet function recovers over the course of 48 hours.
name: Abciximab
side_effect: Constipation, ileus, bleeding, thrombocytopenia, atrial fibrillation/flutter, complete AV block, palpitation, SVT, abnormal thinking, dizziness human antichimeric antibody development.

indications: Alcohol deaddiction.
contraindications: Kidney disorder.
name: Acamprosate Calcium
side_effect: Diarrhoea, allergic reactions, irregular heart beat, blood pressure fluctuations, headache, insominia, impotence.

indications: First line therapy in NIDDM after diet has proved insufficient and as an adjunct to existing conventional oral therapy where glycaemic control is inadequate.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity. Diabetic ketoacidosis or cirrhosis, inflammatory bowel disease, colonic ulceration, partial intestinal obstruction, chronic intestinal diseases associated with marked disorders of digestion or absorption and in those who have conditions that may deteriorate as a result of increased gas formation in the intestine. Pregnancy, lactation and children.
caution: On combination with sulphonylurea, acarbose may increase the hypoglycaemia potential of the sulphonylurea.
name: Acarbose
side_effect: Gastrointestinal tract symptoms, abdominal pain, diarrhoea tended to return to pretreatment levels, antacids (aluminium, magnesium salts) have not been shown to ameliorate acute gastrointestinal symptoms of acarbose.

indications: Acute and chronic bronchitis. Bronchial asthma. Sinusitis. Dried rhinitis.
name: Acebrophylline
side_effect: Epigastric pain.

indications: For the relief of pain and inflammation in osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis and ankylosing spondylitis.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity. GI bleeding. Moderate to severe renal impairment. Last three months of pregnancy.
caution: Patients with GI disease, history of peptic ulceration, cerebrovascular bleeding, ulcerative colitis. Crohns disease, systemic lupus erythmatosus, porphyria, haematopoietic or coagulation disorders. The dose should be reduced in patients with mild to moderate hepatic, renal or cardiac function impairment.
name: Aceclofenac
side_effect: Indigestion, heartburn, dyspepsia, diarrhoea, nausea, abdominal pain and flatulence.

indications: For the relief of pain and inflammation in osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis and ankylosing spondylitis.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity. GI bleeding. Moderate to severe renal impairment. Last three months of pregnancy.
caution: Patients with GI disease, history of peptic ulceration, cerebrovascular bleeding, ulcerative colitis. Crohns disease, systemic lupus erythmatosus, porphyria, haematopoietic or coagulation disorders. The dose should be reduced in patients with mild to moderate hepatic, renal or cardiac function impairment.
name: Aceclofenac Sodium
side_effect: Indigestion, heartburn, dyspepsia, diarrhoea, nausea, abdominal pain and flatulence.

indications: Venous thrombosis. Pulmonary embolism. Atrial fibrillation with embolisation.
contraindications: Hepatic of renal impairment. History of peptic ulcer. Cerebrovascular haemorrhage. Pregnancy and lactation.
caution: Hypertension, weight changes, elderly acute illness, Vit K deficiency.
name: Acenocoumarol
side_effect: Rash, fever, diarrhoea, alopecia, agranulocytosis, hepatitis.

indications: Analgesic and antipyretic.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity. Severe hepatic impairment.
caution: Alcoholism - G6PD deficiency. Renal or hepatic impairment.
name: Acetaminophen
side_effect: Nausea, rashes, liver toxicity. Leukopenia is rare. Acute renal tubular necrosis. Very rare, blood dyscrasias.

indications: Epilepsy, adjunct in treatment of oedema due to CHF. Open angle, secondary acute angle closure glaucoma.
contraindications: Liver disease (may precipitate hepatic come). Pregnancy. Adrenal insufficiency. Sodium or potassium depletion. Renal hyper-chloraemic acidosis, prolong therapy in chronic non-congestive angle closure glaucoma.
caution: Gout, diabetes, potassium supplements may be required.
name: Acetazolamide
side_effect: Acidosis, hypokalemia, drowsiness, paresthesias. Hypersensitivity reactions, fever, rashes.
